content.query:
-- This is auto-generated code
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://seyonsynapsemetadata.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',' --default
    ) AS [result]


SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@seyonsynapsemetadata.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]



    -- Examine the data types for the columns

    EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''https://seyonsynapsemetadata.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv'',
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '','' --default
    ) AS [result]'


    --Find max of each column

    SELECT
    MAX(LEN(LocationID)) as Len_LocationID,
    MAX(LEN(Borough)) as Len_Borough,
    MAX(LEN(Zone)) as Len_Zone,
    MAX(LEN(service_zone)) as Len_service_zone
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://seyonsynapsemetadata.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',' --default
    ) AS [result]

    --USE WITH clause to provide explicity data types
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://seyonsynapsemetadata.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',' --default
    ) 
    WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )
    AS [result]



        EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''https://seyonsynapsemetadata.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv'',
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '','' --default
    )  WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )
    AS [result]'


    --find the collation
    select name, collation_name from sys.databases


    --specify the utf-8 collation within with clause
    SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://seyonsynapsemetadata.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',' --default
    ) 
    WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8 ,
        Zone VARCHAR(50) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8 ,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8 
    )
    AS [result]


    --- create a database and update collation and revalidate
    CREATE database nyc_taxi_discovery;

    USE nyc_taxi_discovery


    ALTER DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8

    SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://seyonsynapsemetadata.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',' --default
    ) 
    WITH(
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )
    AS [result]


    -- query subset of Columns

    SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://seyonsynapsemetadata.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',' --default
    ) 
    WITH(
        
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50)
        
    )
    AS [result]


    -- Read data from a file without header query subset of columns and rename columns as per our standards
    SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://seyonsynapsemetadata.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',' --default
    ) 
        WITH(
        locationId SMALLINT 1,
        db_backupoperatororough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        serviceZone VARCHAR(15) 4
    )
    AS [result]
